title: Algorithmic Toolbox
instructor: This online course covered basic algorithmic techniques and ideas for computational problems arising frequently in practical applications: sorting and searching, divide and conquer, greedy algorithms, dynamic programming.

title: Machine Learning
instructor: This course provided a broad introduction to machine learning, datamining, and statistical pattern recognition. I also learnt how to apply learning algorithms to building smart robots, text understanding, computer vision, and other areas.

title: Prompt Engineering for Everyone
instructor: This course aimed to teach me how to talk to conversational AI effectively as well as to move me from a naive approach to prompting to a more systematic one that can extract the maximum value from what AI offers.

title: Digital Systems: From Logic Gates to Processors
instructor: This course gave me a complete insight into the modern design of digital systems fundamentals from a practical point of view. Unlike other classic digital circuits courses, it focuses more on the system than on the electronics that support it.

title: Introduction to AI
instructor: This course covered core AI concepts, including DL, ML, and NN. I examined generative AI models, including LLMs and their capabilities. Furthermore, you’ll examine AI’s application across domains such as NLP, computer vision, and robotics.

title: Crash Course on Python
instructor: This course covered the benefits of programming in IT roles; understand basic Python syntax; figure out how the building blocks of programming fit together; and combine all of this knowledge to solve a complex problem.
